emailTemplateUser:
If we have all the information we need to start processing your request, we will send you an email or a letter with a reference number.

If we need you to provide more details, we will contact you.

What happens next

When we have all the necessary details, it can take up to 30 days to send you the information. 

Asking for an update during this time may mean it takes longer to get the information you want. 

Receiving the information

Any information we can send you will be sent to the email or postal address you provided.

Your request is protected by the Data Protection Act which means the information is confidential. 

Do not reply to this email. Any replies will not be checked regularly. This email address is for sending this acknowledgement only.

Contacting us

If you haven't heard from us after 30 days, you can contact:

If you've requested any information from the prison or probation services (HMPPS), email:data.access1@justice.gov.uk

For requests that did not want any information from the prison or probation services, email:

data.access@justice.gov.uk

Tell us your name and the date you made the application.
name: Request personal information
phaseText: This is a new service - your [feedback](https://eu.surveymonkey.com/r/G5SWVCT) will help us to improve it.
